intro: Oreoselinum dahuricum, commonly known as Siberian parsley, is a flowering plant native to the colder regions of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots, celery, and dill, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30-60 centimeters and has finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its flowers are clustered in umbels, a common feature among members of the carrot family. Oreoselinum dahuricum is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
